text: EXCLUSIVE: When State Department inspector general Steve Linick was abruptly fired, he was looking into a massive, controversial weapons sale to Saudi Arabia. Now the Trump administration wants to sell Riyadh even more weapons, The Daily Beast has learned. https://t.co/GpObJOknAA

name: thedailybeast
text: Two sources say the Trump administration is proposing a smaller arms deal with the Saudis that includes precision-guided munitions—Congress condemned a similar sale in 2019, and will likely push back against a new one. https://t.co/GpObJOknAA

name: thedailybeast
text: The prospective sale demonstrates the bond between the Trump administration and Saudi Arabia, despite the punishing war in Yemen and the grisly murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi which have severely eroded trust in the Saudis.  https://t.co/GpObJOknAA

name: thedailybeast
text: Furthermore, a memorandum prepared by the State Department’s legal team in 2016 warned that aid to the Saudis for the war in Yemen could open U.S. officials up to war crimes charges.  https://t.co/GpObJOknAA

name: thedailybeast
text:
Yet advocates for the sale, from Jared Kushner and Peter Navarro, remain in top echelons of government.

Read the full exclusive by @ErinBanco, @attackerman, @swin24, and @arawnsley here:  https://t.co/GpObJOknAA
